***
### Advance Procurement Notice
#### Canadian Multi-Mission Aircraft Program Training Facility
#### Greenwood, NS

#### Background
This Advance Procurement Notice (APN) is an early indication of potential contracts with security requirements for interested consultants and contractors. It allows interested parties to begin the security clearance application process and to familiarize themselves with the project details.

#### Program Overview
The Canadian Multi-Mission Aircraft Program involves the acquisition of long-range patrol aircraft to replace the existing CP-140 Aurora fleet. The new aircraft will be based at Canadian Forces Base 14 Wing Greenwood, NS, and CFB 19 Wing Comox, BC. The program consists of new infrastructure and renovations to existing infrastructure to support the new aircraft at both bases.

#### Potential Contracts
Two Modified-Design Build (MDB) contracts are anticipated, one at each base. The MDB contract for Greenwood will involve:

* Concept design for a fast-tracked interim operational flight and maintenance training facility
* Concept design for a new, full operational flight and maintenance training facility
* Design development, construction drawings, and specifications for the interim and new facilities
* Construction of the interim facility, including space for a full-motion flight simulator and other systems
* Construction of the new facility, including space for two full-motion flight simulators and other systems

#### Security Requirements
To be eligible for contract award, consultants and contractors must hold an active Facility Security Clearance (FACILITY SECURITY CLEARANCE, FSC) at the SECRET level. Defence Construction Canada (DCC) offers sponsorship through its Industrial Security Program (ISP) to facilitate the security clearance process.

#### ISP Sponsorship Process
 Consultants and contractors interested in participating in the program must submit a sponsorship request to DCC. The request should include the contract number (81655) and the level of clearance requested. Defence Construction Canada will review the request and forward the package to Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) for processing.

#### Access to Documents and Submission of Offers
Please visit http://www.merx.com for access to documents and to submit an offer. Fees may apply. See https://www.merx.com/public/pricing for more information. ***
